title: Berry Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
recipe:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Add mixed berries and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes using an Ice Tapper and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients: [['1⁄2 fresh', 'Lime (fresh) (chopped)'], ['3 spoon', 'White caster sugar'], ['3 fresh', 'Raspberries (fresh)'], ['2 fresh', 'Blackberries'], ['3 fresh', 'Blueberries (fresh)'], ['1 fresh', 'Small ripe strawberries (hulled)'], ['6 cl', 'Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']]

title: Blue Blazer
recipe:
You will need a pair of large silver-plated tankards (blazer mugs) with handles. Preheat these with boiling water and warm the whisky. POUR the whisky into one tankard and fresh boiling water into the other. Ignite the whisky using a long match and while still blazing pour the whisky into the other tankard. Then mix ingredients by pouring them from one tankard to the other. The foolhardy increase the distance between the tankards as they pour, thus creating a spectacular long blue flame between the two. Extinguish flame by covering flaming tankard with base of the other tankard, pour into glass and sweeten to taste by stirring in powdered sugar.

WARNING - please practice with water first to perfect your method. Stand on a non-flammable floor and have suitable fire-fighting equipment nearby. The following recipe makes two drinks.
ingredients: [['12 cl', "Dewar's 12 Year Old Scotch whisky"], ['12 cl', 'Boiling water'], ['1 spoon', 'Powdered sugar (ground in mortar and pestle)']]

title: Brandy Crusta
garnish: Some merely shove a wide long piece of lemon peel around the inside of the glass rim, leaving the drinker to push the peel down into the glass in order to sip from the drink. Instead I prefer the peel to become a watertight extension to the glass. Find a lemon which fits snugly in the top of a small wine, flute or sour glass. Cut off both ends of the fruit and carefully remove the pulp to leave a barrel-shaped shell of skin. Place in the top of the glass. Wet the edge of the glass and exposed fruit shell with sugar syrup and dip in caster sugar to frost the edge of both peel and glass. Leave for a couple of hours to form a hard crust that helps secure the peel.

title: Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
recipe:
1. Cut a ripe lime in half (from pole to pole) and remove the core from each half by cutting a cut a v-shaped grove. You'll need one-half of the lime per drink and this should be chopped into wedges and each wedge chopped in half before dropping the resulting 6 or 8 lime chunks into the base tin of a shaker.

2. Add 3 bar spoons powdered sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. If using cubed ice straight from the freezer, add chilled water (or optionally add fruit of choice) and MUDDLE some more. If using watery ice then omit some or all of the water/juice.

4. When sure the limes's juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, POUR the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the shaker tin used to muddle and swirl to rinse tin before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to mix with other ingredients.

6. If using cubed ice, crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes using an Ice Tapper and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients: [['1⁄2 fresh', 'Lime (fresh) (chopped)'], ['3 spoon', 'Powdered sugar (ground in mortar and pestle)'], ['2.25 cl', 'Chilled water (omit if using wet ice)'], ['6 cl', 'Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']]

title: Absinthe Drip Cocktail (French method)
recipe: POUR absinthe into glass. PLACE cube of sugar on a slotted absinthe spoon resting across the top of the glass. Using an absinthe fountain (or a bottle of chilled mineral water with a small hole in the cap), DRIP iced water over the sugar so it dissolves and drips into the glass. Traditionally the same amount of water is added as absinthe, but full-strength absinthe requires more dilution - Keep dripping until absinthe louches (turns milky white). Add ice, stir and serve.
ingredients: [['4.5 cl', 'La Fée Parisienne absinthe'], ['6 cl', 'Chilled water'], ['1 cube', 'Sugar cube']]

title: Absinthe Drip Cocktail (Czech method)
recipe: PLACE sugar cube on a slotted absinthe spoon resting across the top of the glass. POUR the absinthe over the sugar cube into the glass. LIGHT the absinthe soaked cube and leave to burn and caramelise. Using a bottle of chilled mineral water with a small hole in the cap, DRIP water over what's left of the sugar so it dissolves and drips into the glass. Add ice, stir and serve.
ingredients: [['4.5 cl', 'La Fée Parisienne absinthe'], ['6 cl', 'Chilled water'], ['1 cube', 'White caster sugar']]

title: Morning Glory Fizz
recipe:
SHAKE first 6 ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker. DRY SHAKE (without ice) and slowly pour 2/3rds of the contents of the shaker from a higher than normal height into a chilled empty glass (no ice in glass) while simultaneously pouring soda with your other hand. The cocktail and soda should form a single stream of liquid falling into the glass.

As when pouring a Guinness, to achieve a perfect head on a fizz, the cocktail should be left to settle for at least a minute before topping off with what remains in the shaker. Ideally, during the settling period, the glass should be placed in a glass froster/fridge/freezer. As the final contents of the shaker are poured into the glass so the head should rise like a souffle.
ingredients: [['6 cl', 'Speyside single malt Scotch whisky (from freezer)'], ['0.25 cl', 'La Fée Parisienne absinthe'], ['2 cl', 'Lemon juice (freshly squeezed)'], ['1 cl', 'Lime juice (freshly squeezed)'], ['1.5 cl', 'Sugar syrup (65.0°brix, 2 sugar to 1 water rich syrup)'], ['2 cl', 'Pasteurised egg white'], ['Top up with', 'Thomas Henry Soda Water']]

title: Passion Fruit Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
recipe:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Chop passion fruit in half and scoop flesh into the rocks glass and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients: [['1⁄2 fresh', 'Lime (fresh) (chopped)'], ['3 spoon', 'White caster sugar'], ['1 fresh', 'Passion fruit'], ['6 cl', 'Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']]

title: Ramos Gin Fizz
garnish: Quarter orange wheel on rim (& optional mint sprig)
recipe:
SHAKE first 8 ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker. DRY SHAKE (without ice) and slowly pour 2/3rds of the contents of the shaker from a higher than normal height into a chilled empty glass (no ice in glass) while simultaneously pouring soda with your other hand. The cocktail and soda should form a single stream of liquid falling into the glass.

As when pouring a Guinness, to achieve a perfect head on a Ramos Gin Fizz, the cocktail should be left to settle for at least a minute before topping off with what remains in the shaker. Ideally, during the settling period, the glass should be placed in a glass froster/fridge/freezer. As the final contents of the shaker are poured into the glass so the head should rise like a souffle.

Some Ramos Gin Fizz recipes, and indeed Henry Charles Ramos' original recipe, call for old tom gin (also our preference), in which case you may need to reduce the amount of sugar syrup depending on your old tom, personal tastes and citrus fruit.
ingredients: [['6 cl', 'Portobello Old Tom gin'], ['1.5 cl', 'Lemon juice (freshly squeezed)'], ['1.5 cl', 'Lime juice (freshly squeezed)'], ['2.25 cl', 'Sugar syrup (65.0°brix, 2 sugar to 1 water rich syrup)'], ['0.125 cl', 'Orange flower/blossom water'], ['3 drop', 'Vanilla extract (optional)'], ['2.25 cl', 'Pasteurised egg white'], ['2.25 cl', 'Single cream / half-and-half'], ['Top up with', 'Thomas Henry Soda Water']]

title: Raspberry Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
recipe:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Add raspberries and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients: [['1⁄2 fresh', 'Lime (fresh) (chopped)'], ['3 spoon', 'White caster sugar'], ['8 fresh', 'Raspberries (fresh)'], ['6 cl', 'Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']]

title: Ti Punch
garnish: The lime disc in the drink is garnish enough but also consider expressing a lime zest twist over the drink and then discarding.
recipe:
Traditionally the limes used to make this drink are not cut into slices or wedges. Instead, a round disc is cut from the side of the fruit. These are cut large enough that some of the fruit's flesh backs the peel of the disc.

POUR the rum and sugar into glass. Then SQUEEZE the lime disc between finger and thumb before dropping into the drink. This expresses the oil from the skin and little of the juice into the Ti'Punch. STIR and consider adding ice - either one or two large cubes depending on glass size, or preferably, a small chunk of block ice.

title: Tom & Jerry
recipe:
1. Pre-warm six 20cl (6.75oz) toddy glasses or Tom & Jerry mugs with hot water.
2. Using a whisk, BEAT the yolks in a mixing bowl "until they are thin as water." Add sugar, Jamaican rum, spices and STIR thoroughly with whisk.
3. In a separate bowl, use a whisk to BEAT the egg whites "to a stiff froth."
4. Use a tablespoon to FOLD the frothy egg whites into the spiced and beaten yolk mixture. This produces the gloopy base mixture known as 'Tom & Jerry batter'.
5. To make individual drinks, to each of the warmed glasses or mugs, POUR cognac and rum, and add two table spoons of Tom & Jerry batter. STIR each glass/mug thoroughly with a barspoon while topping with boiling water.
6. Each should end up with frothy head ready to receive the garnish of grated nutmeg. Serve and enjoy.
ingredients: [['2 fresh', 'Egg white'], ['2 fresh', 'Egg yolk'], ['6 spoon', 'White caster sugar'], ['1.5 cl', 'Overproof pot still rum'], ['2 pinch', 'Cinnamon powder'], ['2 pinch', 'Clove'], ['3 pinch', 'Freshly grated nutmeg'], ['4.5 cl', 'Rémy Martin 1738 Cognac'], ['1.5 cl', 'Havana Club 7yo rum'], ['Top up with', 'Boiling water']]

title: Tropical Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
recipe:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz/15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

4 POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer), coconut liqueur and pineapple juice (also chilled) into the shaker base or glass used to muddle and swirl to rinse before pouring into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

5. Use an Ice Tapper to crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).

title: Benton's Old Fashioned
recipe:
STIR bourbon and maple syrup in base of mixing glass until syrup dissolves. Add bitters and ice and STIR again. Strain into ice-filled glass.

*To make fat-washed bourbon: Grill 4 slices of bacon to obtain 30ml/1oz of warm fat (originally made using Benton's bacon, hence the name, but any extra-smoky bacon will suffice) and pour this into a 70cl of bourbon (in a 75cl bottle). Leave to infuse at room temperature for a day before placing bottle in a freezer to solidify the fat. Then clarify the bourbon by straining into a clean bottle.

recipe:

1 jalapeno
1 bottle Velvet Falernum

Coarsely chop 1 chile de arbol and 1 jalapeno and infuse with a bottle of velvet falernum for 3 days. Strain and re-bottle.

Combine 5 parts water to 1 part Himalayan pink salt. Stir to dissolve and store in a dropper bottle.

recipe:

Special ingredient #1: Duck fat washed Jack Daniel’s Old No. 7
Pour bottle of Jack Daniel’s into pan with 200g duck fat. Cook on low heat until duck fat melted. Allow to cool enough to pour into a sealable container and then freeze. This will allow the duck fat to be strained out of the whiskey. Return the duck fat washed whiskey to bottle for use.

Special ingredient #2: Pear & Honey Posca
Skin 5 pears and cook with bottle of white wine and ½ cup of honey until pears become translucent. Strain throw coffee filter and bottle ready for use.

Special ingredient #3: Tansy & pisco tincture
Infuse 200ml pisco with 5 soup spoons of tansy for 3 days or cook for 3 hours/55˚C in water bath. Strain through coffee filter and the tincture is ready to use.

title: Estrella Porno Martini
recipe:
1. To make a Estrella Porno Martini you’ll first need to flavour your tequila with a vanilla pod. Simply cut the vanilla pod lengthways to expose the flavoursome seeds inside and drop the whole vanilla pod into your bottle of tequila. Reseal and shake bottle several times a day for at least two days, preferably a week.

2. To make your cocktail, wash and cut passion fruits in half, SCOOP out the seeds and flesh of 3 halves into shaker. (Keep last passion fruit half for garnish). Add next four ingredients (all but champagne), SHAKE with ice and fine strain into chilled glass. POUR champagne into chilled shot glass to serve on the side. Instruct drinker to sip alternately from each glass.
ingredients: [['1 1⁄2 fresh', 'Passion fruit'], ['6 cl', 'Patrón Silver blanco tequila'], ['1.5 cl', 'Passoã liqueur'], ['1.5 cl', 'Vanilla sugar syrup'], ['1.5 cl', 'Lime juice (freshly squeezed)'], ['6 cl', 'Brut Champagne']]

title: Blueberry Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
recipe:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Add blueberries and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients: [['1⁄2 fresh', 'Lime (fresh) (chopped)'], ['3 spoon', 'White caster sugar'], ['10 fresh', 'Blueberries (fresh)'], ['6 cl', 'Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']]

title: Blackberry Agave Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
recipe:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass and MUDDLE.

2. Add blackberries and MUDDLE some more.

3. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

4. Add agave syrup to serving glass.

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients: [['1⁄2 fresh', 'Lime (fresh) (chopped)'], ['6 fresh', 'Blackberries'], ['3 cl', 'Agave syrup'], ['6 cl', 'Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']]

title: French Kiwi & Apple Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
recipe:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Add Kiwi fruit and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. Add apple juice and anis liqueur, then STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).

title: Caipirinha (no added sugar & low-calorie)
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
recipe:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and slice on half into 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add sweetener and MUDDLE.

3. If using cubed ice straight from the freezer, add chilled water (or optionally add fruit of your choice) and MUDDLE some more. If using watery ice then omit water.

4. When sure muddling has fully extracted fruit juice, POUR the muddled fruit and sweetener into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (the glass used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to mix with other ingredients.

6. If using cubed ice, crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients: [['1⁄2 fresh', 'Lime (fresh)'], ['1.5 cl', 'Sugar-free sweetener'], ['2.25 cl', 'Chilled water'], ['4.5 cl', 'Novo Fogo Silver cachaça']]

title: Clarified Vodka Milk Punch
recipe:
Milk Punch Base pre-batch (scale-up recipe according to requirement)
1. POUR first 7 ingredients (with peels from the zests lemons & orange) into a sealable container and leave to infuse for 12 hours in a refrigerator.
2. Hot milk method HEAT milk until just starting to simmer and pour (while still simmering) into the container containing vodka tea and juice mix. The milk should curdle. Reseal and chill for at least 2-3 hours and up to 24 hours.
OR 2. Cold milk method POUR cold milk into the container containing vodka tea and juice mix. The milk should curdle. Reseal and chill for at least 2-3 hours and up to 24 hours.
3. Fine STRAIN mixture through cheesecloth or Superbag into a large jar or another container. Ideally, this should be in a refrigerator (I removed a shelf in ours) with the cheesecloth/bag hung over the jar.
4. Repeat step three, without removing curds from the filter or move to a finer strainer (e.g. from a 400-micron bag to a 100-micron bag) or coffee filter.
5. Stored in the refrigerator this will keep for a week (and potentially months) but be sure to sterilise containers etc.

Cocktail itself
STIR 50ml pre-prepared Milk Punch Base with 50ml vodka and 7.5ml sugar syrup and strain into ice-filled glass (preferably over a chunk of block ice)

title: Strawberry Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
recipe:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons powdered caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Add strawberries and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes using an Ice Tapper and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).

title: Bird of Paradise Gin Fizz
recipe:
SHAKE first 5 ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker. DRY SHAKE (without ice) and slowly pour 2/3rds of the contents of the shaker from a higher than normal height into a chilled empty glass (no ice in glass) while simultaneously pouring soda with your other hand. The cocktail and soda should form a single stream of liquid falling into the glass.

As when pouring a Guinness, to achieve a perfect head on a fizz, the cocktail should be left to settle for at least a minute before topping off with what remains in the shaker. Ideally, during the settling period, the glass should be placed in a glass froster/fridge/freezer. As the final contents of the shaker are poured into the glass so the head should rise like a souffle.
ingredients: [['6 cl', 'Portobello Old Tom gin'], ['3 cl', 'Lime juice (freshly squeezed)'], ['1.5 cl', 'Raspberry (framboise) sugar syrup'], ['3 drop', 'Orange flower/blossom water'], ['2 cl', 'Pasteurised egg white'], ['Top up with', 'Thomas Henry Soda Water']]

title: Magic Hour
garnish: The lime slice used to rim the glass AND the two slices of Lombok chili pepper used in the mixing will serve well as very colorful garnish.
recipe: Slice the long way a southeast Asian long 'Lombok' mild red chili pepper, removing all seeds and stem. Add to a mixing glass of ice. Add the lime juice and vodka and pineapple liqueur and stir well. Rim a chilled Old-Fashioned glass with a slice of juicy lime. Strain in the cocktail. Note: the liqueur provides sufficient sweetness; anything like sugar on the rim would be overkill. I used Bali Moon Pineapple Liqueur which does not appear on Diffords list yet. The Lombok is a mild and moist fresh chili which actually has a small bite of capsis to it; not as sharp as a jalapeno. This is a delightfully light and clean drink thanks to the few ingredients and acidity of the lime juice. Ingredients look beautiful. Please forgive terrible glass. I am open to suggestions for a better vessel!

title: LaMarhattan
recipe:
> Ice a Martini glass.

>Fill a stainless cocktail shaker with ice:
Add 1.5 oz Maker's Mark,
Add 1 oz Italian sweet vermouth,
Add 0.5 oz Luxardo cherry liqueur,
Add 2 dashes Angostura bitters (yellow cap).

> Shake till its too cold to hold.

> Dump the ice from the Martini glass and place one or two Luxardo maraschino cherries in the glass; on a pick if you wish.

IMPORTANT: no cheap day-glo-red faux maraschino cherries!

> Strain the drink via the shaker's strainer into the glass.

> Sip slowly, but finish while still cold.

>Rinse glass, and repeat as necessary.

title: Chicago Fizz
recipe:
SHAKE first 5 ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker. DRY SHAKE (without ice) and slowly pour 2/3rds of the contents of the shaker from a higher than normal height into a chilled empty glass (no ice in glass) while simultaneously pouring soda with your other hand. The cocktail and soda should form a single stream of liquid falling into the glass.

As when pouring a Guinness, to achieve a perfect head on a fizz, the cocktail should be left to settle for at least a minute before topping off with what remains in the shaker. Ideally, during the settling period, the glass should be placed in a glass froster/fridge/freezer. As the final contents of the shaker are poured into the glass so the head should rise like a souffle.

title: Mark's Chicago Fizz
recipe:
SHAKE first 5 ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker. DRY SHAKE (without ice) and slowly pour 2/3rds of the contents of the shaker from a higher than normal height into a chilled empty glass (no ice in glass) while simultaneously pouring soda with your other hand. The cocktail and soda should form a single stream of liquid falling into the glass.

As when pouring a Guinness, to achieve a perfect head on a fizz, the cocktail should be left to settle for at least a minute before topping off with what remains in the shaker. Ideally, during the settling period, the glass should be placed in a glass froster/fridge/freezer. As the final contents of the shaker are poured into the glass so the head should rise like a souffle.
ingredients: [['3 cl', 'Tawny port'], ['1.5 cl', 'Lemon juice (freshly squeezed)'], ['0.75 cl', 'Sugar syrup (65.0°brix, 2 sugar to 1 water rich syrup)'], ['1.5 cl', 'Pasteurised egg white'], ['3 cl', 'Soda (club soda) water'], ['3 cl', 'El Dorado 3 Year Old White Rum']]

title: Maira's Red Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
recipe:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass (pulp part up).

2. Add blueberries.

3. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted (but don't over muddle) and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass.

6. POUR cachaça into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass.

7. Pour crème de cassis.

6. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed. Serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients: [['1⁄2 fresh', 'Lime (fresh)'], ['3 spoon', 'White caster sugar'], ['10 fresh', 'Blueberries (fresh)'], ['1.5 cl', 'Crème de cassis liqueur'], ['6 cl', 'Cachaça']]

title: Old Fashioned
recipe:
1. sprinkle a cube of brown cane sugar in a mixing glass with 2 dashes of Angostura Bitter and a dash of Angostura Orange Bitter Alternatively you can sprinkle the sugar with a bar spoon of water.

2. now crush the cane sugar cube with a Muddler (or alternatively with a bar spoon) quickly and with jerky / thrusting movements. Speed is important here. The sugar should dissolve as completely as possible to avoid a crunch.

3. now add the bourbon. Let any sugar residues dissolve by stirring with a bar spoon or by muddling.

Attention: If you have used water to dissolve the sugar cube, you should now add the Angostura Bitters!

4. now add enough ice to the mixing glass and stir for a maximum of 30 seconds to prevent dilution.

5. strain the drink into a pre-frozen Old Fashioned glass and a large ice cube with a Julep Strainer and squeeze orange zest over the drink and add it to the drink.
ingredients: [['6 cl', 'Woodford Reserve bourbon'], ['2 dash', 'Angostura Aromatic Bitters'], ['1 dash', 'Orange Bitters by Angostura'], ['1 cube', 'Sugar cube']]

Strain into a chilled martini glass. Top with chilled Merchant's Heart Hibiscus Tonic. Garnish with sprig of thyme.

Adapted recipe:
In a clean, covered container, infuse thyme and hibiscus for one hour in the fridge.
Shake 7.5ml chilled water, 10ml gin, 10ml lavender syrup, 20ml elderflower cordial, four drops Angostura Aromatic Bitters, and one small ice cube. Strain this into a chilled martini glass. Top up with half infused tonic, half fresh tonic. Garnish with hibiscus petals.

title: Eric's Caipirinha
recipe:
1. Cut a ripe lime in half (from pole to pole) and remove the core from each half by cutting a cut a v-shaped grove. You'll need one-half of the lime per drink and this should be chopped into wedges and each wedge chopped in half before dropping the resulting 6 or 8 lime chunks into the Rocks glass.

2. Add 1 gram of demerara sugar + 10ml simple sugar syrup (or 5ml rich) and MUDDLE HARD.

3. When sure the limes's juice is fully extracted but the sugar not entirely dissolved, POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) and STIR with spoon.

4. Use cubed ice scraps, (the cubes that haven't set with a perfect shape or that are not complete) and drop into serving glass (they will melt faster and provide a constant welcome dilution). STIR before topping with more ice scaps and serve with a kiwifruit slice.
ingredients: [['1⁄2 fresh', 'Lime (fresh)'], ['2.25 cl', 'Chilled water'], ['6 cl', 'Cachaça'], ['1 gram', 'Demerara / dark Muscovado / brown sugar'], ['0.5 cl', 'Sugar syrup (65.0°brix, 2 sugar to 1 water rich syrup)'], ['1 slice', 'Kiwi fruit (fresh)']]

title: The Centre of the Galaxy
garnish: Garnish with a rim sugar made with equal quantities of freeze-dried raspberry powder with fine sugar.
recipe:
First make a raspberry syrup by mixing 100-125g (per cocktail) of fresh raspberries with a scant tablespoon of Demerara sugar. Add a splash of water and warm over a low heat in a small saucepan. Gently break up the mixture so that it becomes soupy and then pass through a fine sieve and then a muslin cloth to yield a clear syrup. Add more Demerara sugar to taste but you want it to be quite sour so don't overdo the sweetness.

Mix cooled raspberry syrup with the other ingredients and shake with ice until very cold - pour into a coupe glass or split into two nick and noras to share.

title: Trillium Gin Fizz
garnish: Tender mint leaf, bruised in Vanilla Suger Orange Peel String
recipe:
-- Reserve Egg White and Seltzer refrigerated.
-- Shake remaining ingredients with about 100 grams whole ice cubes until well chilled and properly diluted - about 90 seconds should be sufficient.
-- Strain into chilled, air-tight shaker (critical).
-- Add Egg White and Seltzer
-- Seal and shake vigorously for at least 2 minutes.
-- Open the shaker (there should be an audible release of CO2)
-- Fill a tall, straight-sided, chilled 9oz highball glass to the rim and place in refrigerator to rest for 3 minutes.
-- Reseal shaker with reserve (there should be ~40ml).
After rest:
-- Retrieve highball glass
-- Briefly shake reserve in shaker
-- Puncture foam head with stir stick or the like
-- Pour reserve through head causing it to rise above the rim of the glass.
-- Serve with desert spoon
ingredients: [['6 cl', 'Trillium Barrel Reserved Gin'], ['1.5 cl', 'Lime juice (freshly squeezed)'], ['1.5 cl', 'Lemon juice (freshly squeezed)'], ['3 cl', 'Double cream / heavy cream'], ['4 dash', 'Orange flower/blossom water'], ['1 spoon', 'Vanilla sugar'], ['1 fresh', 'Egg white'], ['3 cl', 'Carbonated/Sparkling/Selzer mineral water']]

title: Shelby's Cucumber Jalapeño Tequila
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick) slice of lime, cucumber and jalapeño
recipe:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons agave nectar (or ½oz/15ml agave syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Add cucumber and jalapeño and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball or a double old fashioned glass).

5. POUR tequila (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring tequila into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients: [['1⁄2 fresh', 'Lime (fresh)'], ['3 slice', 'Cucumber (fresh)'], ['1⁄6 inch', 'Jalapeno slice'], ['3 spoon', "Re'al Blue Agave Nectar Natural Sweetener"], ['6 cl', 'Blanco tequila (100% agave)']]

title: Dave's Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
recipe:
1. Cut a ripe lime in half (from pole to pole) and remove the core from each half by cutting a cut a v-shaped grove. You'll need one-half of the lime per drink and this should be chopped into wedges and each wedge chopped in half before dropping the resulting 6 or 8 lime chunks into the base tin of a shaker.

2. Add 3 bar spoons powdered sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. If using cubed ice straight from the freezer, add chilled water (or optionally add fruit of choice) and MUDDLE some more. If using watery ice then omit some or all of the water/juice.

4. When sure the limes's juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, POUR the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the shaker tin used to muddle and swirl to rinse tin before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to mix with other ingredients.

6. If using cubed ice, crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).

title: Amanda's Strawberry Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
recipe:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Add chopped strawberries and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients: [['1⁄2 fresh', 'Lime (fresh)'], ['3 spoon', 'White caster sugar'], ['6 cl', 'Cachaça'], ['4 fresh', 'Small ripe strawberries (hulled)']]

To make drink
Add Olmeca, Pamplemousse Rose liqueur,dash of Peychauds And 25ml of the cordial (see below) top with soda.

Ingredient
Acid adjusted Passion fruit and Yuzu Cordial

To make 1ltr
Zest 3 Yuzu into 500gms powered sugar steep overnight then add Yuzu juice.
Remove pulp from 10 passion fruit add to Yuzu Sherbet. Sous vide for 3hrs
Add 10gms malic acid. (Malic is chosen as the Agave plant produces this at night.)
Fine strain and bottle
Keep in the fridge for 2weeks.

title: Otoño Paloma
garnish: A grapefruit slice sprinkled with ground cinnamon.
recipe:
ADD tequila, lime juice, grapefruit juice, Cointreau, cinnamon simple syrup*, and 2 dashes of grapefruit bitters to a shaker filled with ice. Shake until chilled. Strain into a Rocks or Collins glass filled with ice. Top with 1-2 oz soda water. Garnish.

*Cinnamon simple syrup recipe*
Combine 1 cup granulated sugar, 1 cup filtered water, and 4 cinnamon sticks (broken into large pieces) in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce and simmer - stirring frequently - until the sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool. Discard cinnamon sticks and strain into a jar with a lid.

title: In the Ngāhere (Forest)
recipe:
First you need to make the kawakawa tea and simple syrup.

Kawakawa simple syrup:
1 cup white sugar
1 cup water
8-10 kawakawa leaves
Bring to a simmer, take off the heat and let leaves steep for 1hr.

Kawakawa tea:
Add 5-6 leaves to a 500ml of water and bring to a simmer. Turn the heat off and allow tea to steep for 15min. Remove the leaves and strain into a jar or small jug.

Instructions:
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice, and strain into a chilled glass

title: Sunday In The Park
recipe: In a cocktail shaker with ice, combine 1.5 ounces Lillet, 1.5 ounces of bourbon (we like Buffalo Trace), an ounce of fresh lemon juice, a dash of Angostura bitters, and a quarter-ounce of simple syrup (equal parts sugar and water). Toss a full thyme sprig in there, too. Shake hard, and double-strain (that is, through a fine mesh strainer) into a tall glass with fresh ice. Add an ounce or two of soda water to top it off and garnish with a new thyme sprig.
